entry.content:
Zenlist: Classifieds for Every Website

Zenlist is based on a simple idea: Let visitors to any website connect and transact via classified ads. In the process, we’re making online classifieds more social and giving website publishers a new way to generate revenue. Think “Craigslist meets Google ads”. To this end, we’ve created the first embeddable classified listings system that also includes a managed content network.

We previously raised a small seed round from Paris- and San Francisco-based angel investors. Today we have a functional minimum viable product in private beta release.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a talented, energetic and proactive senior developer: Someone who can jump into an existing project with an existing architecture, and lead us though a high-pressure growth stage. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to get into a promising startup early, and help us innovate and disrupt a multi-billion-dollar global industry.

Requirements

You should be ninja-level in:

  • Python / Turbogears
  • MongoDB
  • jQuery
  • Hand-tooled JavaScript
  • xHTML, CSS

In addition, the following skills/experience are critical:

  • Unix server administration
  • Third-party authentication protocols (Facebook, Twitter, Google, Yahoo!)
  • API development
  • Development of highly scalable systems

Responsibilities

We’re looking for more than just a developer. We’re looking for someone with architectural vision, business savvy, and entrepreneurial energy.

  • Maintain, streamline, and improve our existing technology platform
  • Design and implement new algorithms to power our search and recommendation engines
  • Contribute to our R&D of innovative content acquisition and distribution methods

What We Can Offer

We are an early-stage startup with minimal resources, and we are therefore seeking someone who is not afraid to take risks. We offer a basic minimum salary, as well as significant equity in our company.

Interested?

Send your CV and a cover letter to lorin@zenlist.com
